problem.p: The motion of a particle \(y(t)\) is Simple Harmonic and described by the graph below. Answer the following questions:

Part 1. Assume that \(A\),\(B\) and \(\omega_0\) are all non zero positive constants. The function that best describes the motion of the particle is:
\( y(t)= A \cos ( \omega_0 t ) \) \( y(t)= A \sin ( \omega_0 t ) \) \( y(t)= A \cos ( \omega_0 t ) + B \sin ( \omega_0 t ) \)
